intro: Neolourya pierrei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Neolourya pierrei thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
